meanings.definition: A device that converts direct current into alternating current.
meanings.sent1: The inverter changed the battery's power into usable electricity.
meanings.sent2: The solar panels needed an inverter to convert the energy.
meanings.sent3: The inverter was like a magic wand, turning one type of power into another.
meanings.sent4: The inverter was a chameleon, transforming the current effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The inverter hummed softly as it worked its electrical magic.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that inverts something.
meanings.sent1: She was the inverter of the family dynamics, always flipping the mood.
meanings.sent2: The artist was known as an inverter of traditional painting techniques.
meanings.sent3: The inverter of the group's plans, he always had a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an inverter, constantly turning problems into solutions.
meanings.sent5: He was the inverter of expectations, never following the usual path.

meanings.definition: A logic gate that outputs the opposite of its input.
meanings.sent1: The inverter in the circuit ensured the signal was reversed when needed.
meanings.sent2: The computer program used an inverter to control the binary code.
meanings.sent3: The inverter in the system was like a mirror, reflecting the input.
meanings.sent4: The inverter acted like a rebellious child, always going against the flow.
meanings.sent5: The inverter was the yin to the input's yang, balancing the logic perfectly.
